data.title: Printing newspapers is expensive
data.statement:
John works for a newspaper business on a distant planet. He must review a proposed article headline and remove all smiley faces ({{:)}}) from the headline because the writer included them as a prank. He must also calculate the cost of printing [[x]] number of newspaper copies. Cost of printing a single character in the newspaper headline is {{2}}. But because this planet has a broken economy, every next character (even whitespace) doubles the total cost of that newspaper copy (a newspaper copy with blank headline, i.e. with zero characters costs {{1}}).

You must output the number of smiley faces ({{:)}}) in [[proposedHeadline]] string and the cost of printing all newspaper copies calculated by the given formula <<2 ^ [[y]] * [[x]]>> where [[y]] is the length of the headline after removing all smiley faces.
data.constraints:
2 ≤ length of [[proposedHeadline]] ≤ 25
0 < [[x]] < 10000
0 ≤ [[Number of smiley faces]] ≤ length of [[proposedHeadline]] / 2

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

John works for a newspaper business on a distant planet. He must review a proposed article headline and remove all smiley faces (:)) from the headline because the writer included them as a prank. He must also calculate the cost of printing x number of newspaper copies. Cost of printing a single character in the newspaper headline is 2. But because this planet has a broken economy, every next character (even whitespace) doubles the total cost of that newspaper copy (a newspaper copy with blank headline, i.e. with zero characters costs 1).

You must output the number of smiley faces (:)) in proposedHeadline string and the cost of printing all newspaper copies calculated by the given formula 2 ^ y * x where y is the length of the headline after removing all smiley faces.
Input
Line 1: String proposedHeadline for the proposed article headline that may include smiley faces (:)) as a prank.
Line 2: Integer x for the number of newspaper copies to be printed.
Output
Line 1: Number of smiley faces (:)) in the proposed article headline.
Line 2: Total cost of printing all newspaper copies.
Constraints
2 ≤ length of proposedHeadline ≤ 25
0 < x < 10000
0 ≤ Number of smiley faces ≤ length of proposedHeadline / 2
Example
Input
abc:)
5
Output
1
40
